title: KC Masterpiece ID
content:
[http://cdn1.moneysavingmom.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/KC-Masterpiece...](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822211318/http:/cdn1.moneysavingmom.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/KC-Masterpiece-Coupons.jpg "http://cdn1.moneysavingmom.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/KC-Masterpiece-Coupons.jpg")

Please excuse the repost, not sure where the original post went. Looking for an ID on both the 'KC' and the 'Masterpiece'. Thanks mucho in advanced.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822211318im_/http:/typophile.com/files/KC-Masterpiece-Coupons_5841.jpg)
author: markmont

comments.content:
I can't find an exact match but both "KC" and "Masterpiece" could be a further emboldened/compressed/modified **[Candida (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822211318/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Adobe&ffam=Candida%20-%20Bold&fid=85d904da14aa9f03c2c0d9fdc3800c2b&fstyle=b&fsize=60&text=KC%20Masterpiece&fit=1)** by Jakob Erbar [1930]

PS: You can find your previous posts by going to your profile page:  
 [http://typophile.com/user/37463](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822211318/http:/typophile.com/user/37463 "http://typophile.com/user/37463")

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822211318im_/http:/typophile.com/files/KCMasterpieceLabelTypophile112896SM_3664.jpg)
  
U.S. federal trademark registration for this design was filed on September 20, 2011  
 [http://www.trademarkia.com/kc-masterpiece-85427596.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822211318/http:/www.trademarkia.com/kc-masterpiece-85427596.html "http://www.trademarkia.com/kc-masterpiece-85427596.html")  
I believe this is lettering/artwork and not based on a single font.  
In some ways the letters are similar to a sans with Clarendon style serifs added to the base and top of the vertical strokes. Check for example the letter-forms and terminals for C, c and e in Euro Sans Cond Bold [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/euro-sans-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822211318/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/euro-sans-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/euro-sans-pro/") There are also similar features with some serif fonts, such as the lobe on r Jakob Erbar's Candida, as suggested by Fivos. Also, Walbaum or Sirba [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/type-together/sirba/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822211318/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/type-together/sirba/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/type-together/sirba/") for the top terminal on the s. The diamond dot on the i is a feature of some Fraktur designs.  
Don
